Article Title: Diplomats stay on in Bangladesh, families & others sent home
Article Text:
Hasina still stuck in India

NEW DELHI: Amid the continued threat of violence in Bangladesh, India withdrew all non-essential staff and families from the Indian high commission in Dhaka. The high commission remains functional with Indian diplomats and officials going about their business as usual.Significantly, as reports emerged that the Muhammad Yunus-led interim govt will be sworn in on Thursday, a senior functionary of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party ( BNP ), which has had a rocky relationship with India, told TOI the party wants healthy ties with India.“Our acting chairman ( Tarique Rahman ) has maintained that a country’s people can change its economy, politics and govt but they can never change their neighbours. We want a healthy relationship with India,” said A K M Wahiduzzaman, who is information and technology affairs secretary with the BNP. The party has been invited by the military to join the interim govt.Currently in exile in Malaysia, Wahiduzzaman is an aide to London-based Rahman who is BNP leader and Sheikh Hasina ’s long-time rival Khaleda Zia ’s son. The official said BNP workers were working to quell violence in the country, including against minorities. “They are guarding police stations where there’s no police and also temples,” he said.Asked about the choice of Nobel Laureate Muhammad Yunus as the head of the interim govt, Wahiduzzaman said this issue was not really of concern to the BNP as it seeks an early return to democracy. “An unelected govt for too long won’t be good for Bangladesh. We want elections to be held in the next 3 to 6 months,” he said, as he denied reports that Rahman has returned to Dhaka from London.Indian officials did not confirm if they have had any contact yet with BNP which has been accused by supporters of Hasina of joining anti-India Jamaat-e-Islami in transforming students protests against Hasina into a movement for regime change.Govt sources said the return of non-essential staff and families from Indian high commission in Dhaka had taken place on a voluntary basis and through commercial flights. “All diplomats remain there and the high commission is functional,” said a source.With asylum not forthcoming from anywhere, Sheikh Hasina remained at a “safe house” in India. Her continued presence here will likely put India in a bind as the new dispensation in Dhaka is unlikely to approve of it. Hasina’s son Sajeeb Wazed was quoted as saying by a German agency Wednesday that she will likely remain in Delhi for now as there is no decision yet on moving to another place.
Article Summary: India withdrew all non-essential staff and families from the Indian high commission in Dhaka. The high commission remains functional with Indian diplomats and officials going about their business as usual. A senior functionary of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party ( BNP ), which has had a rocky relationship with India, told TOI the party wants healthy ties with India.

Article Title: PM tells Vinesh Phogat she’s pride of every Indian, asks PT Usha to explore ways to help wrestler's case
Article Text: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday expressed solidarity with ace wrestler Vinesh Phogat after her heartbreaking disqualification from the Paris Olympics and spoke to Indian Olympic Association president P T Usha to lodge a strong protest with the International Olympic Committee to explore ways if the games administration could still revisit the ruling.“The PM spoke to Usha and sought first-hand information on the issue and the options India has in the wake of Vinesh’s setback. He asked Usha to explore the full range of options to help Vinesh’s case,” a govt source said.Consoling Vinesh over her disqualification, Modi said on X, “Vinesh, you are a champion among champions. You are India’s pride and an inspiration for each and every Indian. Today’s setback hurts. I wish words could express the sense of despair that I am experiencing. At the same time, I know that you epitomise resilience. It has always been your nature to take challenges head on. Come back stronger. We are all rooting for you.”In a statement in Lok Sabha, sports minister Mansukh Mandaviya said the PM had asked Usha, who is in Paris, to take “appropriate action” in the matter. Later, he said the IOA had lodged a strong protest with United World Wrestling after Vinesh was disqualified.Wishing many laurels in future for Vinesh, President Droupadi Murmu said she “embodied the truly indefatigable spirit of Indian women, and her epic fortitude and resilience were already inspiring future world champions from India”.Home minister Amit Shah said Vinesh’s setback had broken the hopes of millions of Indians. “She has a brilliant sporting career, shining with the glory of defeating the world champion. This misfortune is merely an exception in her trailblazing career, from which I am sure she will bounce back to be the winner she always is. Our best wishes and support are always with her,” he said.
Article Summary: PM Narendra Modi expressed solidarity with ace wrestler Vinesh Phogat after her heartbreaking disqualification from the Paris Olympics. Modi spoke to Indian Olympic Association president P T Usha to lodge a strong protest with the International Olympic Committee to explore ways if the games administration could still revisit the ruling.

Article Title: Morari Bapu concludes nine-day spiritual event at UN
Article Text: Spiritual leader Morari Bapu concluded a nine-day Ram Katha discourse at the United Nations Headquarters. The event, held from July 27 to August 4, marked the first time a spiritual leader led such an event at the UN , focusing on themes of peace, unity, and global harmony.He dedicated his discourse to the United Nations, emphasizing its role in fostering global peace .After the event, he walked to the General Assembly Hall, where he placed a copy of the Ram Charita Manas, a version of the Ramayana by Goswami Tulsidas, and recited the Vedic hymn:During the event, Bapu met with UN Deputy Secretary-General Amina J Mohammed, who noted, “While you had circumambulated the United Nations Headquarters building earlier, you are now at its heart.” She also emphasized the alignment of his teachings with the UN's mission, particularly the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).Morari Bapu responded by pledging that his “Vyaspeetha will always be with the UNO program for world peace, world progress, and world happiness.” He also called on world leaders to rise above narrow interests and work towards ending conflicts in places like Israel and Ukraine.Throughout the event, Morari Bapu connected themes from the Ram Charita Manas to the United Nations’ SDGs, particularly in promoting peace, environmental sustainability, and social justice. He used the example of Ram Rajya, the rule of the ideal king Lord Ram, to illustrate a model code of life that aligns with the principles upheld by the UN.
Article Summary: Morari Bapu concluded a nine-day Ram Katha discourse at the United Nations Headquarters. The event, held from July 27 to August 4, marked the first time a spiritual leader led such an event at the UN. He dedicated his discourse to the UN, emphasizing its role in fostering global peace.

Article Title: India's online visa portal now accepting applications from Chinese nationals for e-Business visas
Article Text: NEW DELHI: India’s online visa portal has enabled Chinese nationals to apply for e-business visas , facilitating fast-track approvals for those coming in to execute projects under the production-linked incentive scheme.Sources in the government said China has been added to the drop down menu for online application of e-business visas.“The existing visa portal has added China to the drop-down menu to enable Chinese and other foreign nationals to apply for e-business visas for PLI projects,” said an officer.E-business visas, which involve a processing time of just 72 hours, allow multiple entries and have a validity of 365 days, with a continuous stay during each visit not exceeding 180 days.
Article Summary: India’s online visa portal has enabled Chinese nationals to apply for e-business visas. The move will fast-track approvals for those coming in to execute projects under the production-linked incentive scheme. E- business visas involve a processing time of just 72 hours.

Article Title: Maharashtra government woos minorities ahead of polls, sets up Minority Research & Training Institute
Article Text: MUMBAI: In a bid to woo minority community votes a decision was taken in the state cabinet to establish a Minority Research and Training Institute ( MRTI ) on the lines of ' Babasaheb Ambedkar Research and Training Institute (BARTI), Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Research, Training and Human Development Institute (SARTHI), Mahatma Jyotiba Phule Research & Training Institute (MAHAJYOTI) and Academy for Maharashtra Research, Upliftment and Training (AMRUT) for overall development and removing backwardness of the minority community.Samajwadi Party MLA Rais Shaikh said setting up MRTI is a welcome move, but govt must make fund allocations immediately and this announcement shouldn't turn out to be an election gimmick.“Mahayuti govt's decision to set up the MRTI is certainly a welcome move. I wrote multiple letters on this issue to the govt highlighting how the students from the minority community are being deprived of the benefits that other communities are getting through BARTI, Mahajyoti, Saarthi, Amrut, etc. This was a much needed move to ensure benefits of higher education to the students of disadvantaged minority communities. However, the state govt must make adequate budgetary allocations for the same. We want to see this announcement turning it into reality. It shouldn't be election propaganda to woo the Muslim community ahead of the assembly elections,” Shaikh said.“A total of 11 posts will be created for this organization. Similarly, the cabinet has also approved a total expenditure of Rs. 6.25 crore is expected. Muslims, Jains, Buddhists, Christians, Jews, Sikhs, Parsis are the minority citizens of the state. Problems related to their social, educational, economic development will be studied through this institution,” said an official.
Article Summary: A decision was taken in the state cabinet to establish a Minority Research and Training Institute. Muslims, Jains, Buddhists, Christians, Jews, Sikhs, Parsis are the minority citizens of Maharashtra.

Article Title: Allegations of removing preamble from textbooks is baseless: Prof Ranjana Arora, NCERT
Article Text:
NCERT’s response on the issue

What changes have been made to NCERT textbooks?

For textbooks of class 3:

For textbooks of class 6:

NEW DELHI: The National Council of Educational Research and Training ( NCERT ) has made notable adjustments to its curriculum for the current academic year by removing the Preamble to the Indian Constitution from several Class 3 and Class 6 textbooks . This change affects textbooks in subjects such as languages and environmental studies.For Class 3, the Preamble has been excluded from textbooks for Hindi, English, Mathematics, and "World Around Us," which replaces the former Environmental Studies (EVS) subject.Previously, the Preamble was featured in the introductory pages of these books, serving as an initial exposure to the core values of the Indian Constitution.In Class 6, the Preamble is no longer present in the new English textbook "Poorvi" and the Sanskrit textbook "Deepakam." The environmental studies content has been reduced from three textbooks to one. However, the Preamble remains in the Hindi textbook "Malhar" and the science textbook "Curiosity."In response to concerns about these changes, NCERT stated in an official tweet that their educational materials aim to provide a thorough understanding of constitutional values. Professor Ranjana Arora, Head of the Department of Curriculum Studies and Development at NCERT, stated in the official statement, "The notion that only the Preamble reflects constitutional values is false. We intend to impart these values in a variety of ways, in line with theNEP-2020 's vision for holistic child development.NCERT has responded to the controversy surrounding the removal of the Preamble from textbooks, claiming that the claims lack substance. NCERT tweeted, "For the first time, NCERT is emphasising various aspects of the Indian Constitution, including the Preamble, Fundamental Duties, Fundamental Rights, and the National Anthem, across different textbooks and stages." The assumption that only the Preamble expresses constitutional values is flawed. Children can also learn these values from Fundamental Duties, Fundamental Rights, and the National Anthem, all of which are equally important for holistic development under NEP-2020.Check the official statement below-The Preamble has been removed from all new textbooks, including those for Hindi, English, Mathematics, and "World Around Us." Previously, it was included in the old EVS book "Looking Around" and the Hindi book "Rimjhim 3."In the updated textbooks aligned with the NEP-2020, the Preamble remains in the Science book "Curiosity" and the Hindi book "Malhar." It has been omitted from the Social Science book "Exploring Society: India and Beyond," which instead covers fundamental rights and duties. The previous editions included the Preamble in the English book "Honey Suckle," the Science book, the Hindi book "Durva," and all three Social Science books.The new English textbook "Poorvi" includes the National Anthem, while the Sanskrit textbook "Deepakam" features both the National Anthem and the National Song, but not the Preamble. The earlier Sanskrit book "Ruchira" also did not include the Preamble.
Article Summary: National Council of Educational Research and Training ( NCERT) has made notable adjustments to its curriculum. The Preamble to the Indian Constitution has been removed from several Class 3 and Class 6 textbooks. This change affects textbooks in subjects such as languages and environmental studies. NCERT has responded to the controversy, claiming that the claims lack substance.

Article Title: Chennai Metro Rail phase 2: Tunnel boring machine achieves breakthrough
Article Text:
The TBM has built a tunnel for a length of around 703 metre, including 51 metre under the river Cooum .

CHENNAI: A tunnel boring machine named Siruvani -- that started tunnelling from Chetpet station to Sterling Road junction station in September 2023 as part of the phase-2 project of Chennai Metro Rail -- achieved a breakthrough on Monday.A release said the TBM built a tunnel for a length of around 703 metre, including 51 metre under the river Cooum.The stretch is part of the 12km underground section of corridor-3 from Kellys to Taramani which is being executed by Larsen & Toubro Limited.L&T is mobilising eight TBMs in the stretch.The two stations are part of the 45.4km corridor-3 from Madhavaram Milk Colony to Siruseri Sipcot linked by 28 underground stations and 19 elevated stations. The 116.1km phase-2 will have three corridors.
Article Summary: A tunnel boring machine named Siruvani started tunnelling from Chetpet station to Sterling Road junction station in September 2023. The stretch is part of the 12km underground section of corridor-3 from Kellys to Taramani. The 116.1km phase-2 will have three corridors.
